title: Typeface from Canadian TV Series
content:
I’ve been trying to find this one. The closest I got was Aldus, but it doesn’t have a bold weight.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907012950im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/credits_5343.JPG)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [credits.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907012950/http:/typophile.com/files/credits.JPG) | 30.96 KB |

 [‹ NY times.com other headline font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907012950/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45690 "Go to previous forum topic") [ito en logo, is it helvetica [neue] oblique? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907012950/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45667 "Go to next forum topic")
author: HSR Classic

comments.content: Hmmm. The lack of serifs on the E crossbar is distinctive.
I know. Is it possible that this was just a Palatino/Book Antiqua rip-off that isn’t digitized?
